channel.title: Panel Mount MIDI DIN to JP3
channel.description: I don't need most of the connections on the core, so I'm just panel mounting what I do need, and wiring it to the board, in order to keep the hardware side of things neat and simple (round holes). I do need MIDI DIN. Am I correct in thinking that I can remove the MIDI/power section of the board, and wire my panel-mounted DINs to JP3? If so, will this be a seamless replacement on the software end?

item.title: Panel Mount MIDI DIN to JP3
item.dc:creator: @tactilesounds Jonathan Murphy
item.description:
@tactilesounds wrote:

Thank you. Good to know. I'll just wire them into the pads behind the DINs on the board, in that case.

Read full topic
item.source: Panel Mount MIDI DIN to JP3

item.title: Panel Mount MIDI DIN to JP3
item.dc:creator: @tele_player
item.description:
@tele_player wrote:

No, you canâ€™t do that. There are a few other MIDI related parts on the MIDI/power board.
